title: Calories in Chocolate Cake
meta_description: Discover calories in chocolate cake per slice, including carbs, fat, protein, full nutrition breakdown, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard bakery slice (~100 g), with chocolate frosting, no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, portion size, and ingredients like butter or sugar content. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: A typical slice of chocolate cake contains about 350 kcal, mostly from carbs and fat.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in one slice of chocolate cake?
faqs.a: About 350 kcal for a standard 100 g slice with frosting.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in chocolate cake?
faqs.a: Around 48 g carbs per slice, including 32 g sugars.

faqs.q: Is chocolate cake high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, typically 16 g total fat per slice, with 6 g saturated.

faqs.q: How does homemade chocolate cake compare to store-bought?
faqs.a: Homemade can vary; richer recipes may add 50-100 kcal per slice.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in chocolate cake?
faqs.a: Low at about 4 g per slice, mainly from flour and eggs.
